title: News Beat
description:
Thought this would make the perfect, very unique style to use drums as filler background music during a very important statement or speech. This track is a little over two minutes long and has just enough soft beats to NOT distract the listener to what is being said.

This was recorded using a Yamaha keyboards GuitarPop style drum rhythm, Audacity & a little improvisation. I must admit...I like what I hear and I think - SO WILL YOU!

No acknowledgement to me is necessary but maybe a shout-out to Yamaha would seem in order.

title: before-after Adobe-enhance remix of Roses1401's freesound#665070.flac
description: See title & ... https://freesound.org/people/Roses1401/sounds/665070/ de-reverb stress-test. Adobe enhance (beta) : AI speech-enhancement (free) https://podcast.adobe.com/enhance Speech, not music. It reduces reverb, sibilance, plosives, breaths, and non-voice sounds. NB: Unusually it is capable of confabulation, e.g. ... https://freesound.org/people/Timbre/sounds/668066/ The output can benefit from compression, EQ, and the merest hint of stereo-reverb, (coz it's mono & too dry in places). Not applied in this example.

keywords: soldier, UPF-CS13, voice, speech, narrative
title: Soldier's speech
description:
Voice of a soldier narrating his experience of his life in a fictitious war conflict.
Recorded with a Shure SM58. Normalized and faded with Audacity.

Full text:
"...que importa. Empuño un arma, defiendo una nación. Ya no se como empezó. Ya no comprendo los porqués. Dentro de esta espiral de terror y sufrimiento deshumanizador. No hay personas, edades, sexos tras la mirilla. Solo veo trozos de carne, amenazas. Otros piensan por mí. Otros aprietan el gatillo por mí. No hay noche, no hay dia, vigilia o sueño. Realidad. Caminando entre cuerpos mutilados..."

keywords: UPF-CS13, voice, speech, refugee, narrative
title: Refugee's speech
description:
Voice of a refugee narrating his experience of his life in a fictitious war conflict.
Recorded with a Shure SM58. Normalized and faded with Audacity.

Full text:
"Desplazado, apartado de mi familia. Vulnerable, impotente aquí fuera. Un grito se rompe dentro de mi, se que nadie lo escuchará de todas formas. Me he quedado congelado en el tiempo, como telonero el silbido de las balas y las bombas caiendo. Salir huyendo de casa antes de que estallara. Mi sangre, su sangre..."

title: Child's speech
description:

Recorded with a Shure SM58. Normalized and faded with Audacity.

Full text:
"..y ruinas. Ya no sonríen. Tengo hambre. Quiero jugar con mi hermana en el patio de afuera. Ahora ella está estirada en el suelo y le sangra la cabeza. No me contesta. Veo fuego que avanza, escucho gritos. Tengo miedo. Quiero abrazar a mi madre, quiero que me lea un cuento antes de ir a dormir. Aprieto el osito de peluche contra mi pecho y cierro los ojos."

title: 18th Century Letter Written Aloud.aif
description: Scene from a radio play: A white bloke with a nasal voice thinking aloud as he writes a letter. The subject of the letter is a music composer who is black, which was unacceptable in England at that time period - how dare a non white attempt such a virtuous undertaking, eh? The writer requests a meeting with some real life famous music bods of the time in London, including Johann Salomon.

title: NJTransit_Newark_Sept2011.aif
description: You can hear the boom and squeal of the train moving fast, the train conductor, and short conversations. I loved how I could feel the sounds this train was making because the rails were so wet from a storm that afternoon and the train was pretty empty. This is the best of a series of recordings I made between Seacaucus Junction and Newark Penn Station on the NJTransit in September 2011 recorded with a zoom2 hand recorder.

title: boys and my gear 12.53 230421_0581
description: One morning I make a long sound recording in nature. In the distance I hear two young lads approaching on a fat bike. They are not older than 12 years. A short funny conversation ensues between them and me. #0:06 to the left! I think we should turn right. #0:13 what is that? #0:17 then the question to me: what is that? #0:19 me softly hoping they drive on: a microphone #0:21 for what? #0:22 i give up and answer: for nature. #0:24 Oh yes I listen with my headphones on and hear them better than they seem to realize when they whisper. #0:32 can you just hear us now? and I say yes #0:36 I pooped my pants. I say: I thought so. and then they ride on laughing like only young boys do. #0:46 Bye, we say -- Of course, they do not know that they have now become world famous on the internet. More here today / More on this spot trough the year / More in this Bossche Broek wetland Date/time: April 21st Friday 2023, 12:53 AM Weather: 12-15c, clouds 95%, wind ESE 17 km/h with gusts to 28 kmh, 1014 hPa, humidity 76%. Location; corner Oude Dommelarm and Donkerhooiweg, protected nature reserve Bossche Broek polder, ‘s-Hertogenbosch (Den Bosch), Noord-Brabant, Netherlands (Holland), Europe, geotag 51.67700 5.29756 If any of these sounds have been of help, and you are feeling charitable, please do consider donating to Freesound to help keep the site running (a link is also on the home page). Any donations are greatly appreciated! YOU ALWAYS HAVE TO CREDIT/ATTRIBUTE me (klankbeeld) and freesound.org in your work if you use this sound. title: numbers_for_free.flac
description: Spoken numbers in a male voice in the English language, such as could be cut apart and assembled automatically in a system like a bank's IVR phone system to read out account balances and such. Recorded using a Shure SM57 mic through a Behringer MIC200 preamp into a Mac G5 Desktop running OS X, with minor edits in Soundtrack Pro and conversion to FLAC in SoundConverter.

title: Stay away from those Perv Boys - Female Vocal - Woman Warns People
description:
Senior woman adamantly warns people to stay away from the nasty perv boys. Could drop this character anywhere you need some extra audio antics. Or in a song :-)
• 3 different takes on the line, this Track repeats 3times with 2 different processes on vocals. #1 is raw vox, nothing added / #2 is "from the radio or loudspeaker" EQ vocal enhancer w/ "warm room" reverb / #3 is "in a large room" "high tone boost" EQ enhancer with "large reflective room" reverb.

This lady may be onto something nefarious, or she might just be a busybody nutter. But maybe stay away from those nasty boys... just in case.  ~eeks!

description:
2x (dry first, fx second)

"all pilots accounted for."
"I copy."
"Affirmative."
"Negative."
"Copy that. Forming up."
"Breaking to attack!"
"Breaking Formation!"
"I'm going in."
"I got a lock on him."
"Dammit! Missed!"
"DIRECT HIT!"
"He's Right beneath you!"
"He's Right on top of you!"
"Coming around!"
"I'm HIT!" (feel free to improv)
"we got blips inbound!"
"Okay people! Last Kill buys the first round!"
"somebody get this guy!"
"He's on me tight ; I can't shake him!"
"We're getting Chewed Up out here!"
"Hold on! I'm almost There!"
"You heard the man! Form Up for Jump out!"
"We're ready to Jump out."
"Nice shooting."

keywords: poor, man, male, human, deep, calling, speech, low, rich, voice, vocal, luck
title: Male Deep Voice - Lines of Dialogue
description:
Deep male voice saying the following lines. Almost sounds like Unkar Plutt from Star Wars The Force Awakens

"Come in poor, walk out reach!"
"You're a lucky fellow, aren't you?"
"Take your chance with Lady Tymora! She is the goddess of good luck in the Forgotten Realms,  and  hence, the patroness of gamblers."

Freesound user Temnix messaged me asking for some voice work October last year  and I finally got around to replying (I originally joined freesound.org to deliver some sounds to help some of my students animation projects). On Groundhogs day I replied to Temnix and realized the reply was months late. Never the less I've now recorded the three following lines for his RPG mod. I'm supposed to be a Dwarven NPC at a fairground enticing folks to play the games of chance.

temnix_rpg_dialogue_lines.WAV

keywords: saw, TrinitatNova, class-struggle, multiculturalism, neighbor, casal, circus, Athenaeum
title: Ateneu Popular de 9 barris.wav
description:
Noise of a radial saw in the Ateneu Popular de Nou Barris, a self-managed socio-cultural center born in 1977 with the occupation of an old asphalt plant. Dialogue of the mountain with the testimony of a neighbor talking about the class struggle and multiculturalism.

Recorded with Zoom H5.

Soroll d'una serra radial a l'Ateneu Popular de Nou Barris, un centre socio-cultural autogestionat nascut el 1977 amb la ocupació d'una antiga planta asfàltica. Diàleg de la serra amb el testimoni d'un veí parlant de la lluita de classes i la multiculturalitat.

Sons enregistrats amb gravadora Zoom H5.

keywords: ball, family, people, park, mud, ambience, TrinitatNova, soundscape, children
title: Plaça de la Trobada.wav
description:
Pla de Fornells Park is a square in the Trinitat Nova that, after some works in 2019, was renamed Plaça la Trobada. At the recording of the acoustic environment, can be heard children playing ball in the park and families talking. This audio is in dialogue with a comment from a neighbor who explains that before the neighborhood streets were paved, there was mud all over the neighborhood.

El Parc del Pla de Fornells és una plaça del barri de la Trinitat Nova que, després d'unes obres l'any 2019 va rebre el nom de Plaça la Trobada. A l'enregistrament de l'entorn acústic s'hi poden sentir infants jugant al parc a pilota i famílies parlant. Aquest àudio es posa en diàleg amb un comentari d'un veí que explica que abans de que els carrers de barri estiguessin asfaltats, hi havia fang per tot el barri.

keywords: male, unhealthy, sickness, blowing-nose, disease, infection, raw, virus, sick, cold, cough, man
title: Sickness 07: blowing nose + cough
description:
It's a part of my pack "Sickness".

Sounds I recorded while being sick.

I got a virus infection resulting in elevated body temperature, lack of strength, cough, running nose and sneezing.

Check the title for what is in this particular recording.

Recorded with Zoom H2 on a mic-stand @ 96kHz/24-bit.

All the sounds in this pack are raw (unprocessed) they were truncated and converted to FLAC (both using Audacity) but not normalized, with original 24-bit precision - turn them up as you need, denoise if you have to, cut out what you want.

Enjoy my pain ;-)

Sounds I recorded while being sick.

Recorded with Zoom H2 on a mic-stand @ 96kHz/24-bit.

All the sounds in this pack are raw (unprocessed) they were truncated and converted to FLAC (both using Audacity) but not normalized, with original 24-bit precision - turn them up as you need, denoise if you have to, cut out what you want.

Enjoy my pain ;-)

keywords: cough, washing, staircase, Rosarinho, tosse, pessoas, cars, people, escadaria, motorcycles, woman, carros, drops, motos, lavando, sidewalk, gotas, watercourses
title: Inicio da Escadaria do Rosarinho
description:
Sábado. Áudio gravado no começo da escadaria do bairro Rosarinho. Na parede da escadaria tinha uma infiltração que fazia gotejar água na escadaria. Ônibus, carros e motos passando na via expressa que fica próxima a escadaria. Uma mulher estava lavando a calçada de sua casa. Uma garota tossia. Um pássaro, talvez um canário, preso na gaiola da casa do lado da escadaria, cantava. 

Gravado por Álex Antônio
Equipamento: gravador Zoom
Data: 28/março/2015
Hora: 17h30

Saturday. Audio recorded at the beginning of Rosarinho ladder. On the steps of the wall was a leak that was dripping water on the staircase. Buses, cars and motorcycles were passing the expressway is near the staircase. A woman was washing the sidewalk of your home. A girl coughing. A bird sang, perhaps a canary, stuck in the cage next to the staircase of the house.

Recorded by Alex Antonio
Equipment: Zoom recorder
Date: March/28 / 2015
Time: 5:30 p.m.


ref.: Morumbi-Rosarinho-STE-010.wav

any changes or requests please feel free to ask/get in touch..!!
enjoy the golf all /=]

keywords: summer, voices, street, motorcycle, CMU, campus, Pittsburgh, beep, outside, bus, helicopter, field-recording, cars, traffic, intersection, signal, car-by, boop, idle, outdoors, crossing, Carnegie-Mellon-University
title: 2 - Forbes & Morewood Intersection - Trk-4 South
description:
Field Recordings from May 24, 2019 on the campus of Carnegie Mellon University at the intersection of Forbes and Morewood Avenues. These recordings were made to capture the sounds of the intersection before the replacement of the crossing signal system, commonly known as the “beep-boop” by students. 

Recorded on a Zoom H6 with Mid-Side Capsule, converted to Stereo
Editing/Processing Applied: High-Pass Filter at 80Hz, 24dB/oct filter

Recorded from the south side of the intersection. 

Stuff you'll hear:
Car bys (throughout, various speeds) 
Helicopter pass
Crossing signal (1:06)
Motorcycle approach
Motorcycle idle for long time
Motorcycle pass
Bus pass
Motorcycle rev
Bus sneeze
Quiet voices walla

keywords: clock, loud, alarm, up, wake, irritable, annoying, laughter
title: Sonic Object Final Copy.wav
description:
Sonic Object Draft: The Perfect Alarm Clock
James Shiel

I used my extra alarm clock as my Sonic Object for this project. It served no needs in my room and I felt an object that already blasts noise could be repurposed for my needs.  My goal with the alarm clock is to take the simple audio device to its next level.  Alarm clocks blast beeping or music to wake up their owners, but why not take their output a bit further? Perhaps I could change it to still act as an alarm clock, but one that uses more extreme tactics to wake up its owner, while still relying entirely on audio to do so.  Perhaps rather than just annoying noises, my alarm clock will play even more motivating noises, like nails on a chalkboard, snoring, strange laughing, uncomfortable bodily noises, or even blatantly terrible or out of key music.  Behind all this I could add an incredibly high-pitched buzz that persists until the owner turns it off. Many of these sounds translated quite well in my piece.  Uncomfortable laughter, irritable buzzing, off key combinations of notes and all around chaos created the “get out of bed now” effect I was aiming for.  I was disappointed that my idea for “psychological triggers” or speech at all in my piece didn’t work with the rest of my sound.  I recorded a number of voices and had a character in mind that my clock might affect, but the speech did more to harm my piece’s impact than to help it, and I decided to leave them out. 
I put a good amount of work into the appearance of the clock as well.  Broken buttons and traces of blood on the top makes it really appear as if it’s being smashed in frustration every morning, and makes it seem all the more vial of a noise machine.
If I were to re do this assignment, I would think more about pacing, as my classmates agreed its climax was weaker than it could have been.  Overall though, I was happy with my piece. It’s irritable and unwelcomed, even to the point I found myself sweating as I worked on it.  As a complete package it definitely looks and sounds as I had hoped: like an alarm clock from hell.

title: AMBUrbn_Residential Area.Children Play.Talk And Shout.Cars Passing By.Passersby.Traffic Noise 1_EM
description: A warm autumn day in an urban residential area. Children run and play around a tall residential complex, the building of which gives very noticeable reflections of sounds. People pass by (sometimes very close) and cars pull into the parking lot. There are conversations, laughter, and children's screams. The noise of urban traffic can be heard in the background. Recorded September 09, 2024 on Tascam DR-05x with post processing. Location: Russia, Ekaterinburg. I ask you, if possible, to help this wonderful site (not me) stay afloat and develop further. Make a donation https://freesound.org/donations/donate/ if my sounds helped or liked you. Freesound remains free of advertising, let's appreciate it together. Enjoy it! I hope that my sounds and phonograms will be useful in your creativity. Feel free to leave your comments with ratings, even if they are critical. Note: audio quality is always better when downloaded. As for attribution, you should credit me in your work. How to do this, see here . This sound CANNOT be used in stock (royalty free) materials. Do not post, publish or redistribute my RAW sounds/files on YouTube or any other sites, platforms or services. My sounds can be used within your projects (including commercial ones, if the license assigned to this sound allows it), as part of an artistic form or design. Otherwise, please adhere to the license rules, which can be found here . I would be glad if you post a link to your finished product on Freesound.org, or a video review of it (in the comments to one or more of my sounds) with a short text stating that this sound was used in this project. This will be a kind of small gratitude for my work. And, of course, it's always interesting to see the live context in which my sounds are used. Thank you.

Everybody laughs.

[2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/sagetyrtle/sounds/36164/ https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ * "laugh5_woman.wav" by sagetyrtle (licensed under the Creative Commons 0 License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/sagetyrtle/sounds/72695/ https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ * "laughter.wav" by sagetyrtle (licensed under the Creative Commons 0 License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/sagetyrtle/sounds/33658/ https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ * "0524laugh.wav" by sagetyrtle (licensed under the Creative Commons 0 License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/sagetyrtle/sounds/73123/ https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ * "spike one.wav" by mrsjones (licensed under the Creative Commons 0 License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/mrsjones/sounds/365184/ https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ * "Giggles - teenage girl young lady.wav" by AderuMoro (licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/AderuMoro/sounds/213290/ https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ * "Rushing_Water-May2013-Take01-Rec_ZOOM_H2n-44.1-16.WAV" by toam (licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution License!) [2020-05-31]. - Links: https://freesound.org/people/toam/sounds/188465/ https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ I downloaded them, cleaned them, made lots of improvements - and finally remastered them. Then I used the seven remastered files to create The Brothel! I mixed these sounds to make it even more exotic! I could've made lots of more changes, however, I wanted to leave the rest up to the listener's fantasy. It was much about planning, knowing what sounds to use, and how to use the different sounds, and timing! If you enjoyed the sound, please STAR, COMMENT, SPREAD THE WORD!🗣 It really helps! 🎯 NOTE: Make sure to check out the other sounds! title: Boulevard SummerRiver calm 04 NL 160905_0961 0962.flac
description: Take 5. friendly ambient recording. A calm boulevard along the river Maas (on 150m) in the Netherlands during summer sunset. Most calm environment with some talking people on the balcony of there apartments. A man running over the boulevard. A lady giggle. A biker passing. some people around the boulevard. A nice sound of grandfathers clock I one of the apartments. A girl child on the balcony. A train in the distance. Two men pass on bikes. Two lady’s passing. The birds in the 150 meter long floodplain. Far some traffic. More at this boulevard today / More at this boulevard trough the year / More at this Maas river Date/time: summer evening September 5h, 2016, start 7.50 pm. Sunset 8-9 pm Weather: clear sky, wind 1-2 down to 0 bft WNW to NW, temp 20c, 1019 hPa Location; Maasboulevard, ‘s-Hertogenbosch (Den Bosch), Noord-Brabant, the Netherlands (Holland), Europe. Geo maps 51.738098, 5.281163 more recordings here search: maasboulevard Den Bosch more along this river trough the year search: river maas klankbeeld HIFI parts of this long recording will be uploaded later Gear chain: modified Rode NT4 XY and Rode NTG1, in Rode Blimp > Sound Devices 302 >Tascam dr-100 Mk2. keywords: fly, take-off, over, flying, ducks, mallard, animal, duck, mandarin, bird, wings, flap
title: mallard and mandarin ducks (with take off)
description:
Well, I was walking aloong in the riparian forest in Leipzig, where you have to cross a small bridge. There is often a guy feeding te ducks. I was there with my mic in the backpack and asked him if he could continue to feed the ducks while I could place the mic in the middle of the feeding spot. At first the ducks were scared because of this strange microphon standing there. So I put some autumn leafs on it to camouflage it. So, this worked and the ducks started to walk around the mic and eat the bread. 

What you can hear ist the giggling of the mallards and the sonourus sound of the mandarin ducks. Also you have quite the rush of a near located highway in the back :-/ I had to cut a little bit, because the "duck man" was talking along and some passers-by, but I wanted to keep it clean from human voices. 

Thats also wy the duck take of in the middle is cutted off. But in the end you will have a clear complete take off again :-) 

Greetings and all the best.

keywords: bass, vibration, twang, spring, boing, metal, vibrating
title: can lid.wav
description:
Got a can of sriracha peas for my birthday. Accidentally plucked the pull-tab. Sounded good. Made everyone pause what was on TV so I could pluck it a bunch. Ate about 3-4 peas. I don't like sriracha. Much less on dry peas. My stomach got upset. Those few peas colored my burps for about an hour. The can lid was the real present all along.

Incidentally captured: chair squeaks (funnily in time with the plucking), "hurry up", "(he's) documenting the sound", chuckling, "is that good enough?"

Pretending to be crying babies.

keywords: funny, crying, cry, crappy, bad, love-story, awful, sad, cheesy, crap, upset, tearjerker, tears, narm, drama, melodramatic, dramatic, sadness, acting, emotional, soundskit, soundskits
title: Cheesy Trying-to-be-a-tearjerker Drama.wav
description: A drama so bad and cheesy, it's funny. The music is really the only sad part, and even then... not so much. In this "drama" that was "sooooo touching", Mary (the squeaky annoying girl) finds out that Johnny (the deep voiced so quiet I had to amplify) guy was her brother. Oh no, it's sooo sad, I need a Kleenex. Waah-haah-hah. This drama sucked. Intentionally. I don't want to make a real drama. (I probably couldn't if I tried.) This sound was made with a headset mic and GarageBand (the violin part). If you need the script: Mary: But Johnny, I love you! Johnny: But Mary, you don't understand! Mary: What don't I understand? Johnny: I-- I am--... Mary: You're what? Johnny: I... I am your brother. Mary: NO! I fell in love with my own brother. *cries* [recording ends]

keywords: Ghost, Mortuary-Chapel, EVP, Paranormal, Electronic-Voice-Phenomenon, Spirit
title: GHOSTLY CALL FOR HELP
description:
*Please read this carefully before contacting me about this recording*

Alone in a former mortuary chapel turned art gallery, this is the sound picked up by my DSLR camera whilst filming an installation. I purposely haven't altered the sound level or any part of this recording. 

In the background you can hear that I have the radio on, and the male and female presenters of the show I was listening to can be heard talking.

Watching the footage I had taken of the art piece months later, apart from the radio, I realised I could also hear what seems almost like sobbing and then more distinctly a female voice asking for help somewhere close by.

keywords: Vintage, Optical, Foreign, Female, France, French, Voice
title: R21-20-Woman Speaking French.wav
description:
Woman speaks French. Very emotional.

Translation:

1. Please understand, inspector, he belonged to an occult society. [sob] He was against me because I made fun of him. [sob] I beg your pardon.

2. - I'm not hysterical, Inspector, only worried. No one wants to believe me [sob]
- Come on, come on, come on...
- Well... As I noticed a moment ago, I'm sure it was him, I recognized his face. I could even see the wound on his forehead.
- Are you sure?
- Yes. But the moon was just illuminating his face. Then he smiled at me, it was more like a grin. It was horrible. [sob] Before he died he often told me that he would come back after he died, to scare me. Of course I laughed about it, who takes such a stupidity seriously? Please understand, inspector, he belonged to an occult society. He was against me because I made fun of him. [sob] I beg your pardon.
- Calm down, madam.

title: wobbly piano feedback.wav
description:
i recorded this quick improvisation with my built-in laptop microphone and track monitoring on in reaper, which resulted in it sounding washed-out, warped, and screechy in the high end. at the beginning you hear the distorted wail of a left click initiating the recording. somebody walks into the living room at the end and we share an exchange. i didn't add any effects or edit this audio in any way, it's just a fun experiment.

Let me know if you use this  something!!!!!

title: Blood in the crypt
description: Some spooky music I made in GarageBand for a thing called Victors Crypt! It's a wailing electric guitar with some organs in the back creating a scary sound. It's a lot of reverb, echo and delay on it. I think of a creepy crypt with blood on floor and walls. Like something really bad just happens.... I believe it would fit anything creepy, scary, haunted. fantasy, horror, terrifying, dystopia or whatever comes to mind. Feel free to use it as long as you give me the credit for it/write me as composer. And subscribe to and watch my channel :) Be cool, watch and subscribe to Victors Crypt: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA8O46_WrQZEhSdZuwFQ3rQ Throw horns, dance & hail Satan!

title: soulsofthedamned.wav
description:
Layered sounds in Audacity from Freesound. 
Started with a screaming crowd from user 'inspectorj'. Then, added screams from user 'scottemoil' (crying-man) and a man's scream from user 'thesubber13' (scream-1). Additional screams from user 'alucardsbride' (crying-woman) and baby crying from user 'the-yura' (crying-newborn-baby-child-2).

Just for an extra layer of terrifying, I added user 'timbre's remix of user 'djgriffin's tibetan chanting. 

Added a reverb to a few of the screams, adjusted volumes and pitch, added some stretch. And when I first played it I almost pissed my pants.

keywords: atmosphere, people, Paris, France, street, balcony, city, support, shout, ambience, casseroles, noise, field-recording, COVID-19, whistle, thank-you, voices, town, Nanterre, suburb, merci, coronavirus, applauses, clap, virus, corona, nurses, nurse, care-givers
title: 200323_1120_FR_StreetApplause.wav
description:
I made this recording in a suburb of Paris (France), while people applause and shout from their windows and balconies, to say thank you to the medical workers (it happens everyday at 8PM) during COVID-19 crisis. 
Recorded in March 2020 with an Olympus LS-P4 and a Rode Stereo videomic X (SVMX). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

keywords: chord, city, field-recording, man, pan-pipe, portugal, portuguese-tradition, salesman, shout, street
title: amolador_pan_pipe.wav
description:
Sound of a salesman announcing in the middle of the street that he is available to sharpen scissors, knifes and other cutting objects. He is playing some chords on a pan pipe and shouting in order to announce himself, while he carries a cart with his tools.
In Portuguese tradition we call them "amolador(es)".
Recorded from a 11 th floor of a building directly in to the street using a cheap condenser microphone, plugged in to the MIC-IN jack of a MZ-NH700 Sony MD Recorder.

keywords: atmosphere, people, Paris, France, street, A-demain, see-you-tomorrow, balcony, city, support, shout, ambience, casseroles, noise, field-recording, COVID-19, suburb, virus, thank-you, voices, town, Nanterre, corona, merci, coronavirus, applauses, clap, nurses, nurse, care-givers
title: 200405_1124_FR_StreetApplause.wav
description:
One more day... 
France has been locked down for 3 weeks already, and it seems supporting care-givers at 8PM from our balconies or windows has became our daily routine, unfortunately... 
But as you can hear in this recording, all my neighbours  are still here to applause and say thank you to our heroes, and plan to be here until that COVID-19 crisis will end, I think ! (As you can hear at the end of the recording, neighbours say ‘’A demain !’’ to each other, which means ‘’see you tomorrow !’’)
As usual, I made this recording from a window of my flat, in a suburb of Paris (France).
Recorded in April 2020 with an Olympus LS-P4 and a Rode Stereo videomic X (SVMX). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

keywords: soundscape, ambience, outdoor, enthusiast, enthusiasm, speaker, street, sports, games, Nanterre, bearer, yell, relay, enthusiastic, runner, torch, Olympics, sport, ardour, music, shout, French, Paris-2024, Olympic, fervour, field-recording, crowd, atmosphere, flame, France
title: 240724_182630_FR_Olympic_torchbearer_starting
description:
Olympic torchbearer starting. 
I made this recording two days before the opening of the 2024 Olympic games taking place in Paris, while the Olympic torchbearers were running through Nanterre, in the western suburbs of the French capital. 
Here, we are at the starting point of the run (at Gabriel Péri stadium), and one can hear hundreds of people waiting and cheering, while loud speakers broadcast some music and the comments of the master of ceremony standing a few meters further. 
After a few seconds, the MC  introduces the Olympic torch which just arrived in our town from an other city (at #0:39), as well as some of the famous bearers who will hold it during the run in our place. 
Then, at #2:09, the first bearer from our town, who is a famous basketball player named Benjamin Sene, will get the torch from the guards, while the MC explains that it is about 70cm high and 1,5 Kg, and that every bearer will run during 200 meters along the streets, before giving it to the next runner. 
Then, after some additional words and some cheering, the final countdown starts at #3:48, and the bearer goes running with the Olympic torch ! 
Recorded in July 2024 with a Zoom H6essential (built-in XY microphones). 
Fade in/out applied in Audacity.

keywords: 2006, action, audiencia, august, barcelona, caixaforum, crowd, disponible, female, freesound, human, la, male, mob, multitudinous, people, performance, scream, screaming, voice, yell, yelling
title: Ahgghh_ses2.wav
description: On the 30th of August, 2006, at Caixaforum ( Barcelona ), Freesound organized a multitudinous (more than 300 people) performance and sound recording called "La audiencia disponible". This sound is one of those recorded that day. Among who made all this possible there is Ruben Grilo, Bram de jong and Jaume Ferrete, with Jose Lozano on sound and Mateo Vergara as crowd conductor and the help and support of Carmen Garrido director of La Mediateca at Fundació la Caixa. Screaming, yelling, everybody at the same time.

Geo 51.770393, 5.532359 Gear chain: Sennheiser mkh30/50 MS, in Rycote cyclone small, windjammer > Sound Devices 302 >Tascam dr-100 Mk2. Decoded Mid-side to STEREO. keywords: catholic, barcelonetasonora, field-recording, holy, people, crowd, procession, barcelona, voices, port, religion, street, drums, spanish, religious, barceloneta
title: Processó Carme 2015 09 - Al Rellotge.wav
description: Sound recorded during the annual procession of Virgen del Carme, the fishermen's patrona. We are inside the port, by the Clock. Here you can hear a man exclamating "Viva la Virgen del Carmen, Viva la reina de los pescadores, Viva la madre de Dios" while the crowd echoes "Viva". Percussions pass by then accompany in the background. Al Rellotge. July 8th 2015, Ilaria Sartori, Zoom H4n (recorder by the main voice).

keywords: Vintage, Wallas, Optical, Crowds
title: R24-04-Unloading Ammunition Truck.wav
description: Men yelling and conversing worriedly and in outrage, in a small group. Some exclamations. The last part is where they unload the ammunition truck. Quieter conversation between fewer men follows, as well as some grunts.

keywords: catholic, barcelonetasonora, field-recording, holy, people, crowd, church, procession, barcelona, voices, religion, street, drums, spanish, religious, barceloneta
title: Processó Carme 2015 03 - P Joan de Borbo.wav
description: Sound recorded during the annual procession of Virgen del Carme, the fishermen's patrona. Here you can hear music and voices accompanying the statue of the Virgin through Pg Joan de Borbó. A man with megaphone animates the crowd with exclamations: "Viva la Virgen del Carmen!". Drums and brass instruments accompany the procession. Voices of public and the people who carry the statue while switching turns (see more recordings in the same pack). July 8th 2015, Ilaria Sartori, Zoom H4n (procession in movement and recorder in movement).

keywords: catholic, barcelonetasonora, holy, crowd, religion, people, procession, barcelona, barceloneta, catalan, statue, spanish, voices, religious, port, boat, field-recording
title: Processó Carme 2015 10 - Salida del barco.wav
description: Sound recorded during the annual procession of Virgen del Carme, the fishermen's patrona. We are at the port dock, in front of the boat which will take the statue of the Virgen into the maritime part of the procession. The crowd pushes to get into the boat and police must intervene in order to let the statue enter the boat first. Moments of tension and danger follow on the dock, while the crowd gets the good moods back by applauding the Virgen and exclamating "Viva la Virgen del Carme!". The crowd is finally directed towards La Golondrina, another boat following the Vigen's boat. The main boat leaves with the statue (motor, exclamations) then you hear voices of people and police walkies on the dock. July 8th 2015, Ilaria Sartori, Zoom H4n (procession in movement and static recorder).

description: Sound recorded during the annual procession of Virgen del Carme, the fishermen's patrona. Here you can hear a man exclamating "Viva la Virgen del Carmen, Viva la reina de la mar, Viva nuestra matrona" while the crowd echoes "Viva". Percussions in the background. keywords: ribbon-mic, Royer, cymbal-swell, cymbal-swoosh
title: cYmbal Swells Royer-029.wav
description: i was demoing the new Digital Performer 10.1 with a Royer R-10 pair in Blumlein array but wanted to check out one of the ribbons because it possibly sounded blown so i went ahead not bothering to create a new mono file. the mic was tracked through a Yamaha mixer into Digital Performer via a MOTU 624. i have various cymbals including a Paiste hi-hat and a Zildjian ride which i bowed or scraped. there is an occasional tiny bit of noise from the hard drive, sorry. it has the hiccups. some of these have an effect or two like a flange on one or more and a bit of delay but mostly you just hear the marvelous and VERY INTERESTING cymbals! all in my apartment in NYC. i wanted to show my gratitude for the Freesound.org website by giving a little something back.
